reason: To handle server-rendered HTML more efficiently and prevent unnecessary DOM manipulation
renderToString does not support streaming or waiting for data, making it unsuitable for scenarios requiring progressive rendering or a fully resolved static HTML output.
React recommends using Web Streams for modern environments like Deno and edge runtimes rather than Node.js Streams, as Web Streams provide better integration in these environments.
React advises usage of Web Streams APIs like `renderToReadableStream` for environments such as Deno or modern edge runtimes due to broader compatibility with Web Streams.

The `resumeToPipeableStream` API, specific to Node.js streams, has largely been replaced by the more versatile `resume` API that supports environments with Web Streams, such as Deno and modern edge runtimes.

The `prerender` API is designed for static site generation (SSG) to render a complete page after all data has loaded, unlike `renderToReadableStream`, which allows streaming content as it loads. Developers requiring streaming should use `renderToReadableStream` instead.
The synchronous version of act does not work consistently due to internal React scheduling, especially with async boundary-crossing code.
Simplified usage and improved readability by introducing a dedicated hook, `useContext`, for accessing context.
React Compiler automatically applies memoization to components, making manual use of React.memo unnecessary.

replaced_by: N/A (no replacement as it is an active API)

reason: Consolidation of APIs for modern forms usage and better alignment with React Server Components.
React Compiler now automatically memoizes values and functions, reducing the need for manual `useCallback` calls.
The `ref` parameter was updated in React 19 to be directly available as a prop, eliminating the need for `forwardRef` in its usage.

useLayoutEffect can hurt performance as it blocks the browser from painting until the layout measurement logic finishes executing. Developers are encouraged to use useEffect when layout information is not needed before repaint.
onKeyPress is deprecated in favor of onKeyDown and onBeforeInput for better reliability and standardization across browsers.
